article_title: Texas continues Medicaid expansion -- for kids
article_text: To continue reading this story, you will need to be a digital subscriber to HoustonChronicle.com.

og.description:
Texas may have rejected the federal expansion of Medicaid, but children continue to swell the program's numbers. 
 Kaiser Health News reported Monday  that that nearly 2.9 million Texas kids aged 6 to 18 were on Medicaid  as of August 2014, up by about 254,000 since December. That number  includes nearly 160,000 children who were shifted to the program from  the Children's Health Insurance Program, or CHIP, as required by a  provision of the Affordable Care Act.
og.title: Texas continues Medicaid expansion -- for kids
